history.text: This one is bound to be loved for years to come.
Yes, it is a total classic and Rotten Tomatoes shows that with their 100% score!
Do you agree with that rating?
I know, I didn't think anything could rate that high but Pixar really delivered
I totally agree, instant classic.
What do you think of the character Mr. Potato Head?
Lol he was pretty funny. I also find it interesting that the toy that was designed to be a ferocious monster(the T-Rex) is actually not scary at all.
I never knew that Joss Whedon and Steve Jobs were involved in the film.
Yes! nervous TRex is such an oxymoron!
John Lassester really knew what he was doing with these characters as the director of the film.
Lol aye, good computer graphics and even a good script can't help without a good pilot at the wheel.
It was amusing that the army toys acted like they were in the army.
And Buzz Lightyear thinks he's a space explorer.
They all seem to adapt to their understanding of their world in different ways, some become cynics while other retain their bright optimism.
I love that they utilized SLinky Dog like a slinky toy. Dashunds are so long and lanky that it was a perfect fit!
Lol agreed! Good character design.
I like that Buzz and Woody were fighting for Andy's attention, it gave it a good story to see them working together eventually.
Yeah, a good message there. They may have seen each other as rivals for his affection, bu there was plenty of room for both of them.
Toy Story truly is one of the best kid's films out there that Pixar has
And this was one of their first, wasn't it? A good first impression any way you slice it.
The best part was when Buzz still kept acting like he was a space ranger. He really committed to his line of work!
Lol he was built for it.
I think it also may be helpful if a family is moving and a child is worried about losing toys in the process.
Did you know that Andy's last name was Davis?!
I didn't realize he had a last name, but then he must.
Yep! It was their first feature film that Pixar ever produced.
I wonder if Woody's rank as Sheriff made me more likely to be their leader or if being built that way just gave him the qualities to become their leader with time.
And for being produced in 1995, thats a pretty big feat to have such graphics with a animated feature film!
Yeah, it really holds up well. I think it is partly due to everything being animated so there isn't that disconnect when cgi is placed next to live action.
It is also funny that these toys who want his affection so much, see that Andy gets a puppy.
I wonder if the new puppy will be able to see the actions of the toys, Sid's dog could.
I think a major lesson in the film is also to not jump to conclusions. Woody was certain that Buzz was trouble and the other toys preemptively judge Woody's actions as well.
You still there, buddy?
I wouldn't want to jump to conclusions like the toys did, lol.
Normally I don't care for Randy Newman's music, just not my jam, but it fit the mood of the movie well.
That Sid, though.
Straight from a nightmare, lol.
I think most people would like the idea that their toys were sentient when they weren't around, it would explain how they sometimes aren't where a person thought they were left.
Especially if the toys were so good-natured like in the film.
Is the response to the test, part of the test? Like for the toys in the crane machine?
Now I know how the toys that Andy stopped playing with felt like.
